byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.

abstract: Russia, responding to downing of one of its warplanes by Turkey, is cutting economic links and investment projects with country; Turkish officials contend there is no reason to apologize, as each country's president, Vladimir V Putin and Recep Tayyip Erdogan, exchange insults; rift puts strain on anti-Islamic State coalition effort.
lead_paragraph: Russia was looking at ways to curb commercial ties and investment projects, possibly including the deal to build a gas pipeline through Turkey.

headline.main: Kremlin Cutting Economic Links With the Turks
headline.print_headline: Kremlin Cutting Economic Links With the Turks

snippet: Russia was looking at ways to curb commercial ties and investment projects, possibly including the deal to build a gas pipeline through Turkey.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
